alert.note: Alert for Owyhee Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued July 27 at 8:39PM MDT until July 29 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITIES WILL CREATE CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS EACH AFTERNOON AND EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY... .Dry southwest flow aloft will continue through Saturday. As a result, gusty southwest winds with low relative humidity will continue into early this evening across Southwest Idaho, especially near the Nevada border, and redevelop Friday afternoon and evening. Gusty winds will spread to Southeast Oregon and far Southwest Idaho on Saturday. The dry and gusty combination will result in periods of critical fire weather conditions. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 9 PM MDT FRIDAY FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITIES FOR OWYHEE MOUNTAINS...WHICH IS FIRE WEATHER ZONE 423... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITIES FOR OWYHEE MOUNTAINS...WHICH IS FIRE WEATHER ZONE 423... ...RED FLAG WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITIES FOR OWYHEE MOUNTAINS... WHICH IS FIRE WEATHER ZONE 423... * WINDS...10 to 15 mph with gusts to 25 mph are expected through the remainder of the evening. Winds are still expected to be on the increase Friday afternoon. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Increase above 15 percent this evening...then lower once again Friday.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will occur shortly. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are possible. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
